issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When a volume is created on Equallogic SAN, it is marked for access using the chap user in Eucalyptus database at that moment. The chap user can be modified using euca-modify-property. If the volume attach request is processed after the chap user has been modified, the updated chap user is employed for iSCSI connection from the NC. Equallogic rejects the iSCSI connection to the volume as the chap users dont match. 

Volume Information on Equallogic SAN, note the chap username. 
{code}
eucagrp> volume show vol-ABCE414A
_____________________________ Volume Information ______________________________
Name: vol-ABCE414A                     Size: 1GB                              
VolReserve: 1.01GB                     VolReserveInUse: 0MB                   
ReplReserveInUse: 0MB                  iSCSI Alias: vol-ABCE414A              
iSCSI Name:                            ActualMembers: 2                       
  iqn.2001-05.com.equallogic:0-8a0906- Snap-Warn: 10%                         
  d8941cf08-0820000002751d8b-vol-abce4 Snap-Depletion: delete-oldest          
  14a                                  Description:                           
Snap-Reserve: 100%                     Snap-Reserve-Avail: 100% (1.01GB)      
Permission: read-write                 DesiredStatus: online                  
Status: online                         Connections: 0                         
Snapshots: 0                           Bind:                                  
Type: not-replicated                   ReplicationReserveSpace: 0MB           
Replicas: 0                            ReplicationPartner:                    
Pool: default                          Transmitted-Data: 1MB                  
Received-Data: 0MB                     Pref-Raid-Policy: none                 
Pref-Raid-Policy-Status: none          Thin-Provision: disabled               
Thin-Min-Reserve: 0% (0MB)             Thin-Growth-Warn: 0% (0MB)             
Thin-Growth-Max: 0% (0MB)              ReplicationTxData: 0MB                 
MultiHostAccess: enabled               iSNS-Discovery: disabled               
Replica-Volume-Reserve: 0MB            Thin-Clone: N                          
Template: N                            NAS Container: N                       
Administrator:                         SyncReplStatus:                        
SyncReplTxData: 0MB                    Thin-Warn-Mode: offline                
Snap-space Borrowing: enabled          Space Borrowed: 0MB                    
Folder:                                                                        
_______________________________________________________________________________


_______________________________ Access Records ________________________________


ID  Initiator                     Ipaddress       AuthMethod UserName   Apply-To
--- ----------------------------- --------------- ---------- ---------- --------

1                                 *.*.*.*         chap       78e8-1001  both    
 


____________________________ Operations InProgress ____________________________


ID StartTime            Progress Operation Details                              

-- -------------------- -------- -----------------------------------------------
{code}

Modified the chap user in Eucalyptus
{code}
# euca-modify-property -p PARTI00.storage.chapuser=abc123
PROPERTY	PARTI00.storage.chapuser	abc123 was 78e8-1001
{code}

Tried attaching the volume. Operation failed with the following error on the NC
{code}
Failed to run '/sbin/iscsiadm -m node -T iqn.2001-05.com.equallogic:0-8a0906-d8941cf08-0820000002751d8b-vol-abce414a -p 10.107.6.3 -l': iscsiadm: Could not login to [iface: default, target: iqn.2001-05.com.equallogic:0-8a0906-d8941cf08-0820000002751d8b-vol-abce414a, portal: 10.107.6.3,3260].
 iscsiadm: initiator reported error (24 - iSCSI login failed due to authorization failure)
 iscsiadm: Could not log into all portals
 Logging in to [iface: default, target: iqn.2001-05.com.equallogic:0-8a0906-d8941cf08-0820000002751d8b-vol-abce414a, portal: 10.107.6.3,3260] (multiple)
{code}

Error on Equallogic SAN. Note the chap username that failed authentication
{code}
3582:758:eucamem1:MgmtExec: 6-Jul-2013 18:12:41.580759:targetAttr.cc:532:ERROR:7.4.3:iSCSI login to target '10.107.6.2:3260, iqn.2001-05.com.equallogic:0-8a0906-d8941cf08-0820000002751d8b-vol-abce414a' from initiator '10.107.105.75:43557, iqn.1994-05.com.redhat:f84e6fe241' failed for the following reason:
	CHAP user abc123 authentication failed.
{code}
fields.summary: Equallogic - Volumes fail to attach after CHAP user is modified

comments.body: The fix would marking the volume for access by a certain chap user when the attach request comes through to the Equallogic provider. Volume creation should not appoint the chap user for accessing the volume, this should be done at the attachment time.

Commit # e569ff9b606470b321720802757cbc7229f347fa

Cause and fix: Please see the notes in description

Volume without an active connection does not have a chap username assigned any more.

{noformat}
eucagrp> volume show vol-0D113CA8
_____________________________ Volume Information ______________________________
Name: vol-0D113CA8                     Size: 1GB
VolReserve: 1.01GB                     VolReserveInUse: 0MB
ReplReserveInUse: 0MB                  iSCSI Alias: vol-0D113CA8
iSCSI Name:                            ActualMembers: 2
  iqn.2001-05.com.equallogic:0-8a0906- Snap-Warn: 10%
  a0741cf08-6f900000f2351e91-vol-0d113 Snap-Depletion: delete-oldest
  ca8                                  Description:
Snap-Reserve: 100%                     Snap-Reserve-Avail: 100% (1.01GB)
Permission: read-write                 DesiredStatus: online
Status: online                         Connections: 0
Snapshots: 0                           Bind:
Type: not-replicated                   ReplicationReserveSpace: 0MB
Replicas: 0                            ReplicationPartner:
Pool: default                          Transmitted-Data: 0MB
Received-Data: 0MB                     Pref-Raid-Policy: none
Pref-Raid-Policy-Status: none          Thin-Provision: disabled
Thin-Min-Reserve: 0% (0MB)             Thin-Growth-Warn: 0% (0MB)
Thin-Growth-Max: 0% (0MB)              ReplicationTxData: 0MB
MultiHostAccess: enabled               iSNS-Discovery: disabled
Replica-Volume-Reserve: 0MB            Thin-Clone: N
Template: N                            NAS Container: N
Administrator:                         SyncReplStatus:
SyncReplTxData: 0MB                    Thin-Warn-Mode: offline
Snap-space Borrowing: enabled          Space Borrowed: 0MB
Folder:
_______________________________________________________________________________


_______________________________ Access Records ________________________________


ID  Initiator                     Ipaddress       AuthMethod UserName   Apply-To
--- ----------------------------- --------------- ---------- ---------- --------



____________________________ Operations InProgress ____________________________


ID StartTime            Progress Operation Details

-- -------------------- -------- -----------------------------------------------
{noformat}

Tests:
a) changed chapuser, then attached volume, it has got a chap username with the initiator in the access records
{noformat}
_______________________________ Access Records ________________________________


ID  Initiator                     Ipaddress       AuthMethod UserName   Apply-To
--- ----------------------------- --------------- ---------- ---------- --------

1   iqn.1994-05.com.redhat:176cc4 *.*.*.*         chap       hulk       both

      9755f
{noformat}
b) attached a volume, changed the chapuser, detached and attached the volume again, it has got the new chapuser on the access records.

Thanks [~swathi]. Let me know if there is anything else I should check for fix.
